poem.content:
In the crater of a once-thriving town,
Where bomb explosions echoed all around,
A tortoise moves slowly, bent and low,
A symbol of endurance, as the years go slow.

The strategy of survival, etched on its face,
As it navigates the ruins, a steady pace,
Arranging the fragments of a shattered past,
A frame of memory, forever to last.

In the elevator of time, it rises high,
To install a new future, born of sorrow's sigh,
But the damage done, the scars that won't fade,
Remind it of the beauty that's been displayed.

Like a tree, it stands, its roots run deep,
A category of strength, where love and hope do creep,
Though thrown by winds of adversity and strife,
It clings to life, a beacon of a brighter life.

In the cycle of rebirth, it finds its way,
Through the rubble of the old, to a new dawn's ray,
A hobby of perseverance, a love of life's design,
A tortoise's tale of resilience, forever entwined.
